results.title: Joshua and the blob
results.creator_credit: Stephen Bosustow, Joshua Films, Stephen Bosustow Productions and John Lange
results.brief_description: Deals with the effect of external influences on a person’s thoughts and behaviour by telling about a person who reacts in various ways to a creature he does not understand. Shows that as his knowledge increases, his behaviour is more effective and his reactions more positive. Animated.

results.title: Joseph Stalin
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biography”.
Depicts the life of Stalin, under whose strong-arm rule the USSR became a world power. Explains Stalin’s part in making Russia a communist state. Commentary by Mike Wallace. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Joseph Schultz
results.brief_description: A young German soldier refuses to fire on a line of Yugoslav partisans. His disobedience costs him his life. Based on an actual event in the Second World War, Joseph Schultz uses both realistic reconstruction and documentary evidence to assert the continuing resonance of resistance.

results.title: Joseph Campbell and the power of myth. Episodes 4-6
results.creator_credit: Catherine Tatge, Apostrophe S Productions, Public Affairs Television and David Grubin
results.brief_description: The final three hours of interviews, conducted by Bill Moyers, with world authority on myth, Joseph Campbell, shortly before his death in 1987. Episode 4 - “Sacrifice and bliss” Campbell discusses the role of sacrifice as a necessity for rebirth and the need for each of us to find a sacred place in today’s modern world. Episode 5 - “Love and the goddess” Covers both the growth of romantic love associated with the 12th century troubadours and the worship of woman as goddess, earth mother and Virgin Mary. Episode 6 - “Masks of eternity” Campbell provides challenging insights into God, religion and eternity as revealed in Christianity, Buddhism, Native American Indian beliefs and the theories of Jung and Schopenhauer.

results.title: Joseph Campbell and the power of myth. Episodes 1-3
results.creator_credit: Catherine Tatge, Apostrophe S Productions, Public Affairs Television and David Grubin
results.brief_description: When Joseph Campbell died in 1987 at the age of 83, he was considered one of the world’s foremost authorities on myth. He wrote over 20 books (eg “The Hero with 1000 faces” and “Masks of God”) and saw mythology as the song of the universe. In the two years prior to his death, Bill Moyers conducted this extensive series of interviews with Campbell at the Californian ranch of filmmaker, George Lucas, whose film “Star Wars was influenced by Campbell’s writings. In episode 1 (“The Hero’s Adventure”) Campbell discusses the function of the hero using “Star Wars” to illustrate this. In episode 2 (“The Message of the Myth”)he reveals the universality of many religious myths, such as the creation myth, and in episode 3 (“The First Storytellers”) he stresses the importance of ritual as enactment of myth.

results.title: Joseph and the amazing technicolor dreamcoat
results.creator_credit: Andrew Lloyd Webber, Really Useful Films, Steven Pimlott and David Mallet
results.brief_description: The first musical blockbuster by the immensely successful Rice and Weber song writing duo, this straight-to-video recording of the spectacular stage production features Donny Osmond as Joseph. Based on the Biblical story of Joseph and his coat of many colors. Joseph is the favorite son of Jacob (Richard Attenborough), but his eleven brothers resent the attention their father showers upon him and sell him into slavery. Eventually, the favored son finds himself in jail, however his favorable interpretation of the dreams of the Pharaoh win him the admiration of the all-powerful leader, and soon Joseph is one of the most powerful men in Egypt. Songs include ‘Close Every Door to Me, ‘Go Go Go Joseph’ and ‘Any Dream Will Do’. Cast also includes Joan Collins and David Grindrod.

results.title: Jose: deserted father (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Suzanne Baker, Bob Kingsbury and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Social Security”.
The story of a deserted father forms one of a series of films created originally for day-time television panel discussions to introduce to the public the range of social services available from Government and other agencies.

results.title: Jose Iturbi. Part 2. Harpsichord
results.creator_credit: Artists Films, Walter Lowendahl, Rudolph Polk and Reginald le Borg
results.brief_description: The well-known concert pianist and films star, Jose Iturbi, explains how the harpsichord functions. To demonstrate his explanation, he plays a composition by Jean Phillipe Rameau; as he plays, close-ups of his hands and feet show clearly the pedal-work and fingering. Iturbi then plays Liszt’s Eleventh Hungarian Rhapsody on the piano.
